## GAD-7 vs SAM

The relevance of accurate and efficient data processing tools like Harmony cannot be overstated in the psychological research industry. One potential application for Harmony is a comparison of the widely-utilised Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Severe Aggression Measure (SAM). Comparing these two measures -- hence, the "GAD-7 vs SAM" comparison -- can offer valuable insights and facilitate further research in both anxiety and aggression disorders. Harmony, with its use of intelligent language models and generative AI, simplifies the harmonisation process. This facilitates the comparison of GAD-7 vs SAM, even when these questionnaires are in different languages. If youâ€™re a psychologist or researcher aiming to draw a parallel between these two instruments, Harmony provides an efficient and less labour-intensive method of doing so. Its database houses a variety of such instruments, making it easier for you to conduct a "GAD-7 vs SAM" comparative study. Therefore, leveraging Harmony for the GAD-7 vs SAM comparison not only expedite the process but may provide a higher degree of accuracy. Following the comparison, you can be better posed to evaluate the correlation between generalized anxiety disorder and severe aggression, contributing further to psychological studies. Harmony's user-friendly interface and robust capabilities make it a vital tool for psychologists working with these types of comparative studies.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and SAM

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SAM into Harmony</a> - compare SAM with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
